column1: '''Quarry''' was a location in the northern [[Eastfarthing]]
column2: to the south of the [[hills of Scary]] and between [[Scary]] and [[Brandywine]]

column1: Quarry could have been simply a stone-quarry<ref>{{HM|N}}
column3: p. 775</ref> but possibly it could also have been a small [[Hobbit]] settlement or a village<ref>[[Robert Foster]]

column1: The word [[Wiktionary:quarry#Etymology 1|quarry]] is derived from Latin ''quarreria'' through French.
[[David Salo]] noted that the usage of a Latin-French word as a place-name is peculiar
column2: in contrast to all other placenames which have [[Old English]] and/or [[Celtic]] etymologies; he suggests that the name perhaps represents a late [[Westron]] word
column3: and not an original [[Hobbitish]] place-name.<ref>{{webcite|author=[[David Salo]]|articleurl=http://groups.yahoo.com/group/elfling/message/121|articlename=Hobbitish Place-names|dated=23 November 1998|website=[[Elfling]]}}</ref>

column2: towns and villages of the Shire]]
